definition: to endure/to suffer/hardships/torments/a hard time/a nuisance
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to go through hell for the sake of keeping up appearances (idiom)
pinyin: si3 yao4 mian4 zi5 huo2 shou4 zui4

sentences.english: He cumbered himself with an overcoat on a warm day.
sentences.chinese: 大熱天穿着件大衣簡直使他活受罪。

sentences.english: You are right. Suffering in the big city is not as good as working in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 說的就是，與其在大城市受罪還不如去農村闖闖呢。

sentences.english: Heart is also very light, very long way.
sentences.chinese: 大人輕心了不少，重要的是孩子不受罪啊。

sentences.english: My swollen knee has given me gyp all day.
sentences.chinese: 我的膝蓋腫了，讓我整天都很受罪。

sentences.english: He's so impatient that waiting in queues is sheer purgatory for him.
sentences.chinese: 他毫無耐性，對他來說排隊等候完全是活受罪。

sentences.english: Then you condemn me to live wretched and to die accursed?
sentences.chinese: 那麼你就是判定我活着受罪，死後要受詛咒了？

sentences.english: I loved her, and I hated to see her so misersble.
sentences.chinese: 我很愛她，不忍心看見她這麼受罪。

sentences.english: The two first dances, however, brought a return of distress; they were dances of mortification.
sentences.chinese: 頭兩場舞重新使他覺得煩惱，那是兩場活受罪的跳舞。

sentences.english: Yet they don't have to suffer anymore Mabinogi Gold.
sentences.chinese: 不過，他們不必再受罪了。

definition: to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
to be born under an ill star
